titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Lasker Collection of Atlases and Maps, 1549-1926
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Emma Gronbeck, September 2024.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Edward Lasker Collection of Atlases and Maps

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Collection of atlases and maps depicting the globe, North and South America, the West Indies, Germany, Wales, and regions of the United States from the 16th to 19th centuries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection of atlases and maps depicting the globe, North and South America, the West Indies, and regions of Europe and the United States from the 16th to 19th centuries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series: Series I. Atlases, [1572]-1926; and Series II. Maps, 1549-1864.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library .

p.archref: Breed Collection of Maps, Documents, and Prints
Richmond John Rathbone Collection of Rare Maps

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Emma Gronbeck, September 2024. Atlases in Series I were catalogued and shelved separately from the maps in Series II.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward Lasker Collection of Atlases and Maps, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: Series I. Atlases,

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by creator or title.

did.unittitle: Series II. Maps,

arrangement.p: Arranged according to original order of portfolios.

did.unittitle: Series I. Atlases,
"Atlas moderne : ou Collection de cartes sur toutes les parties du globe terrestre / par plusieurs auteurs ; avec approbation & privilege du roy," Paris : Lattre & Delalain,
Blaeu, Willem Jansz (1571-1638), "Theatrum orbis terrarum, sive Atlas novus : in quo tabulae et descriptiones omnium regionum," Amsterdami : Apud Iohannem Guiljelmi F. Blaeu,
Blaeu, Willem Jansz (1571-1638), "Guil. et Ioannis Blaeu theatrum orbis terrarum, sive Atlas novus. Pars secunda," Amsterdami : Apud Iohannem Guiljelmi F. Blaeu,
[A collection of maps, most issued by Johann Baptist Homann or his heirs], [S.l.] : [s.n.],
Faden, William, "[Atlas with maps colored according to the Definitive Treaty of Peace, 1815]," [London] : [W. Faden ... [and 10 others in 4 other places],
Grenet, abbé (1750-), "Compendio di geografia antica e moderna formato sulle carte più esatte : opera utilisima per apprendere l'una e l'altra geografia…," Venezia : presso Andrea Santini,

Humphreys, Arthur Lee (1865-1946), "Old decorative maps and charts. With illustrations from engravings in the Macpherson collection, and a catalogue of the atlases, etc., in the collection by Henry Stevens," London : Halton and T. Smith, ltd., N.Y. : Minton, Balch & Co.,

Jefferys, Thomas (-1771), "The American atlas, or, A geographical description of the whole continent of America; wherein are delineated at large, its several regions, countries, states, and islands; and chiefly the British colonies, composed from numerous surveys...," London : R. Sayer and Bennett,

Kitchin, Thomas (1719-1784), "A general atlas, describing the whole universe : being a complete collection of the most approved maps extant; corrected with the greatest care, and augmented from the latest discoveries…," London : Printed for Robert Sayer,

Mercator, Gerhard (1512-1594), "Atlas minor / Gerardi Mercatoris ; à I. Hondio plurimis aeneis tabulis auctus et illustratus : denuo recognit additisque novis delineationibus emendatis," Amsterodami : Ex officina Ioannis Ianssoni,

Ortelius, Abraham (1527-1598), "Nomenclator Ptolemaicus : omnia locorum vocabula, quae in tota Ptolemaei Geographia occurrunt, continens ad fidem Graeci codicis purgatus, & in ordinem non minus vtilem quàm elegantem digestus," Antuerpiae : Typis Roberti Bruneau,

Ortelius, Abraham (1527-1598), "[Theatro del mondo di Abrahamo Ortelio : da lui poco inanzi la sua morte riueduto, & di tauole nuoue, et commenti adorno, & arricchito, con la vita dell'autore / traslato in lingua toscana dal sigr. Filippo Pigafetta]," [In Anversa] : [si vende nella libraria Plantiniana],

Ortelius, Abraham (1527-1598), "[Theatrum oder Schawplatz des Erdbodems warin die Landttafell der gantzen Weldt : mit sambt aine der selben kurtze Erklarung zu sehen ist / durch Abrahaumum Ortelium]," [Antorff] : [Gielis von Diest],
Popple, Henry (-1743), "A map of the British Empire in America : with the French and Spanish settlements adjacent thereto," [London] : [Sold by S. Harding and W.H. Toms],
Wit, Frederik de (1629 or 1630-1706), "Atlas," Tot Amsterdam : Bij Frederick de Wit in de Calverstreat bij den dam inde Witte Paskaert,
Series II. Maps,
